page.title: 03village events
page.content: Wakes Day is by far the most important social event in the community village year. The Wake being a relic of an early religious festival all the money raised on this day goes towards Church Funds and the upkeep of the Everest Hall. Activities take the forms of stalls run by the parishioners selling a variety of goods. In the Autumn a well attended Harvest Festival Supper follows the Church Service. Early in December a Christmas Bring and Buy Sale is followed by an Auction. During the year a number of concerts take place at which our Choir takes part. Autumn evening classes are organised by the W.I. and are always popular. In 1985 it is Country Dancing.
